summary: Two collections of letters, written to and by Charles Darwin. UBC Woodward Library acquired two collections containing letters to and from Charles Darwin, the well-known evolutionary biologist and originator of the concept of natural selection. The main group of letters is the Darwin-Burdon-Sanderson Letters â€“ 1873-1881. This collection was part of a purchase of books and manuscripts from Dr. Hugh Sinclair, lecturer in physiology and biochemistry, Magdalen College, Oxford
